label: 榑材木
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: In the Nara and early Heian period, kure meant a type of batten or deal (see kure in Nihon kokugo daijiten), and we have consequently chosen to treat it as a type of zaimoku, wood as construction material" or, especially, "sawed wood, lumber" (pp. 500-501n). "
